approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: To develop a portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to independently fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, eliminating the current manual request process to the IT data server team.
project_goals: To fetch V-KYC recordings independently for audit and internal requirements.
To provide a self-service portal for VKYC team leads and process managers to access recordings.
To reduce dependency on the IT data server team for recording retrieval.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to retrieve VKYC recordings stored on the LTF NFS server for internal and external (Audit) requirements. This process is inefficient and time-consuming, requiring a change to a more automated and self-service approach.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording retrieval.
Access to the portal shall be provided to VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers.
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be searchable and filterable by date (date, month, year).
Recordings shall be visible and searchable by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing a list of LAN IDs for bulk video recording retrieval.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall be in CSV or TXT format.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
The results of the bulk request shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
A 'Download All' option shall be available for the displayed bulk download results.
The table displaying results shall implement pagination, showing only 10 records at a time.
The bulk download functionality shall download 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a LAN ID in the results table shall initiate the download of the corresponding recording.

functional_requirements: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording retrieval.
Access to the portal shall be provided to VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers.
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be searchable and filterable by date (date, month, year).
Recordings shall be visible and searchable by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing a list of LAN IDs for bulk video recording retrieval.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall be in CSV or TXT format.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
The results of the bulk request shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
A 'Download All' option shall be available for the displayed bulk download results.
The table displaying results shall implement pagination, showing only 10 records at a time.
The bulk download functionality shall download 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a LAN ID in the results table shall initiate the download of the corresponding recording.
non_functional_requirements: The portal access shall be restricted to very limited users (only Team leaders and Process Managers).
The system should be able to retrieve recordings from the LTF NFS server.
The system should handle bulk download requests efficiently for up to 50 LAN IDs.
The user interface should display results with pagination (10 records at a time).
stakeholders: B. Ops â€“ V-KYC Team (Process Owner)
success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently fetch V-KYC recordings via the new portal.
The portal provides access to all approved PL-VKYC case recordings.
Users can successfully search recordings by date and LAN ID.
Users can successfully perform bulk downloads of recordings for up to 50 LAN IDs.
The manual request process to the IT data server team for VKYC recordings is eliminated.
constraints: Maximum 50 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Minimum 2 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Bulk upload file format limited to CSV/TXT.
Table pagination displays only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download functionality downloads only 10 records at a time.
Access to the portal is limited to VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers.
VKYC recordings are present and retrieved from the LTF NFS server.
assumptions: V-KYC recordings are consistently stored and accessible on the LTF NFS server.
A backend API exists or will be developed to process requests for recordings from the NFS server.
The VKYC team has the necessary infrastructure (e.g., internet access, compatible devices) to use the portal and download recordings.
The definition and availability of 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' are clear and consistent.
risks: Data Security: Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive V-KYC recordings if access controls are not robust.
Performance Issues: Potential for slow retrieval or download times for recordings, especially during bulk requests or peak usage.
Data Integrity: Risk of inaccurate or incomplete retrieval of recordings from the NFS server.
System Integration: Challenges in integrating the new portal with the existing LTF NFS server and backend APIs.
Scalability: The system might struggle if the volume of recordings or users increases significantly beyond current expectations.
User Adoption: Potential resistance from users if the portal is not intuitive or reliable.

domain_specific_details.VKYC: Video Know Your Customer, a process for customer identification.
domain_specific_details.LAN_ID: A unique identifier for a customer or case, used to identify specific VKYC recordings.
domain_specific_details.LTF_NFS_Server: L&T Finance Network File System server, the current storage location for VKYC recordings.
domain_specific_details.PL_VKYC_cases: Specific type of VKYC cases, likely related to Personal Loan VKYC, which are in 'Approved' status.

recommendations: Define detailed non-functional requirements, including performance metrics (e.g., response times for single/bulk downloads), scalability, security protocols (beyond just access control), and availability.

Clarify the exact behavior of the 'Download All' option in conjunction with the '10 records at a time' download limit. Does 'Download All' trigger multiple batches of 10, or does it override the limit?
Specify error handling mechanisms for file uploads (e.g., invalid file format, exceeding LAN ID limit, non-existent LAN IDs) and recording retrieval failures.
Detail reporting requirements, even if currently 'NA', to ensure future needs are considered.

identified_gaps: Lack of comprehensive non-functional requirements (e.g., performance, security, reliability, audit trails for access/downloads).
Ambiguity in the bulk download functionality regarding 'Download All' vs. '10 records at a time' download limit.
Absence of error handling specifications for various scenarios (e.g., invalid input, API failures, missing recordings).
No explicit reporting requirements, despite the project being for 'Audit requirements'.
No mention of data retention policies for the recordings on the portal.
No details on how the 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' status is determined or integrated.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to elicit and define detailed non-functional requirements.
Clarify the exact user experience and system behavior for bulk downloads, specifically how 'Download All' interacts with the '10 records at a time' download limit.
Define specific error messages, logging, and recovery procedures for all potential failure points.
Revisit reporting needs with the VKYC team and audit department to ensure the portal supports their full requirements.
Define data retention and archival policies for recordings accessible via the portal.
Document the integration points and data flow for determining 'Approved PL-VKYC cases'.
